classes.name: Employer
classes.description: An entity that pays wages or meets certain thresholds for employing workers.

classes.name: Employee
classes.description: An individual who performs services for an employer in exchange for wages or remuneration.

classes.name: Wages
classes.description: All remuneration for employment, subject to specified exceptions.

classes.name: Employment
classes.description: The performance of any service by an employee for an employer within the scope of the statute.

classes.name: DomesticService
classes.description: Domestic service in a private home or certain college clubs or fraternity/sorority chapters.

classes.name: AgriculturalLabor
classes.description: Labor performed in agricultural settings under the conditions outlined in the statute.

classes.name: Taxpayer
classes.description: An individual (or entity) subject to the tax provisions of the statute.

classes.name: MarriedIndividual
classes.description: A taxpayer recognized as married under section 7703.

classes.name: SurvivingSpouse
classes.description: A taxpayer whose spouse died in one of the two preceding years and who meets certain household conditions.

classes.name: HeadOfHousehold
classes.description: A taxpayer who is unmarried (or considered unmarried) and maintains a home for a qualifying person.

classes.name: Dependent
classes.description: An individual (qualifying child or relative) who meets certain statutory tests under section 152.

classes.name: QualifyingChild
classes.description: A dependent meeting relationship, residency, and age requirements under section 152(c).

classes.name: QualifyingRelative
classes.description: An individual who bears a qualifying relationship, has no income, and is not a qualifying child.

classes.name: Household
classes.description: A household maintained by a taxpayer, potentially relevant to head of household or surviving spouse status.

classes.name: TaxableIncome
classes.description: Gross income minus deductions, or adjusted gross income minus standard deduction.

classes.name: AdjustedGrossIncome
classes.description: Gross income minus certain allowed deductions before itemized or standard deductions.

classes.name: PersonalExemption
classes.description: An exemption amount allowable to a taxpayer and spouse, subject to limitations.

classes.name: UnmarriedIndividual
classes.description: A taxpayer who is not married.

classes.name: Service
classes.description: A class representing the performance of services.

classes.name: USGovernment
classes.description: Represents the United States Government.

classes.name: TaxYear
classes.description: Represents a specific tax year for which a taxpayer is filing.

classes.name: TaxRegime
classes.description: Represents a specific tax regime period (e.g., pre-2018, 2018-2025) with different standard deduction rules.

properties.name: isBlind
properties.description: Indicates that a taxpayer is blind at the close of the taxable year.

properties.name: isNotBlind
properties.description: Indicates that a taxpayer is not blind at the close of the taxable year. Mutually exclusive with isBlind.

properties.name: isAged
properties.description: Indicates that a taxpayer is age 65 or older at the close of the taxable year.

properties.name: isNotAged
properties.description: Indicates that a taxpayer is under age 65 at the close of the taxable year. Mutually exclusive with isAged.

properties.name: isNonresidentAlien
properties.description: Indicates that a taxpayer is a nonresident alien for tax purposes.

properties.name: hasSpouse
properties.description: Indicates that a taxpayer has a spouse as of the tax year in question. Do NOT use this to represent historical spouses from previous years who are no longer spouses due to death or divorce. Only include current spouses relevant to the filing year.

properties.name: doesNotHaveSpouse
properties.description: Indicates that a taxpayer does not have a spouse. Mutually exclusive with hasSpouse.

properties.name: employsIndividual
properties.description: Indicates that an employer has an individual in employment.

properties.name: doesNotEmployIndividual
properties.description: Indicates that an employer does not employ an individual. Mutually exclusive with employsIndividual.

properties.name: hasTotalWagesPaid
properties.description: Indicates the total amount of wages paid by an employer.

properties.name: doesNotHaveTotalWagesPaid
properties.description: Indicates that the employer reports no wages paid. Mutually exclusive with hasTotalWagesPaid.

properties.name: hasAdjustedGrossIncomeAmount
properties.description: Indicates the taxpayer's income BEFORE standard deduction and personal exemptions are applied. This is typically equal to total wages or gross income minus certain adjustments. The system will calculate taxable income by subtracting standard deduction and personal exemptions from this amount.

properties.name: doesNotHaveAdjustedGrossIncomeAmount
properties.description: Indicates that the taxpayer reports no adjusted gross income. Mutually exclusive with hasAdjustedGrossIncomeAmount.

properties.name: claimsDependent
properties.description: Indicates that a taxpayer claims a specific dependent under section 151.

properties.name: doesNotClaimDependent
properties.description: Indicates that a taxpayer does not claim a specific dependent. Mutually exclusive with claimsDependent.

properties.name: filesJointReturn
properties.description: Indicates that the taxpayer files a single joint return.

properties.name: filesSeparateReturn
properties.description: Indicates that a married taxpayer files a separate return rather than a joint return. Mutually exclusive with filesJointReturn.

properties.name: performedFor
properties.description: Indicates that a certain service is performed for the US Government.

properties.name: isEmployer
properties.description: Indicates that the subject is classified as an Employer.

properties.name: isSurvivingSpouse
properties.description: Indicates that the subject is a SurvivingSpouse as recognized by the statute.

properties.name: isMarriedIndividual
properties.description: Indicates that the subject is a MarriedIndividual as recognized by the statute.

properties.name: isUnmarriedIndividual
properties.description: Indicates that the subject is an UnmarriedIndividual as recognized by the statute.

properties.name: isHeadOfHousehold
properties.description: Indicates that the subject is a HeadOfHousehold as recognized by the statute.

properties.name: isService
properties.description: Indicates that the subject is classified as a Service.

rules.description: A married individual who does not file a single joint return with a spouse is subject to the Married Filing Separately tax provisions.
An individual who is unmarried and not a surviving spouse or head of household is taxed under the unmarried individual provisions.
Any service performed in the employ of the US Government is not considered 'employment' per section 3306(c)(6).
